title: Irish Grid References in R
text: Irish Grid (EPSG:29903) coordinate reference system spanning island Ireland. Created Ordnance Survey Ireland (now Tailte Éireann) Ordnance Survey Northern Ireland, locations within Irish Grid defined X Y coordinate. Irish grid references alternative way recording locations Irish Grid. Irish grid reference consists letter, optionally followed easting northing. letter (e.g. “N”) refers particular 100 km square Irish Grid. 25 100 km squares - letter “” skipped. easting northing refer square within 100 km square. Irish grid reference 1-digit easting northing (e.g. “N85”) refers particular 10 km square wtihin 100 km square “N”. 5-digit easting northing (e.g. “N 12345 67890”) refers particular 1 m square. many R packages facilitating spatial data analysis visualisation. igr package designed simplify using datasets containing Irish grid references R. translates Irish grid references Irish Grid coordinates sf objects R packages can work . igr package supports precisions Irish grid reference multiples ten 1 m 100 km, mixes precision, Irish grid references without whitespace letter, easting northing. converting Irish grid references point locations (using igr_to_ig(), st_igr_as_sf() default polygons=FALSE), south west corners relevant Irish Grid squares returned. converting polygons (using st_igr_as_sf() polygons=TRUE), polygons returned span entire square grid reference. functions st_igr_as_sf() st_irishgridrefs() convert sf (simple feature) objects coordinate reference system.

title: Irish Grid References in R
text: development version igr can installed github follows:
code: # Install devtools package if needed install.packages("devtools")  # Load devtools package if needed library(devtools)  # Install development version of igr package from github install_github("digitalnature-ie/igr")

title: Irish Grid References in R
text: igr package loaded normal way:
code: library(igr)

title: Irish Grid References in R
text: validity Irish grid references can checked function igr_is_valid().
code: # Sample of valid and invalid Irish grid references igrs <- c("A", "A16", "A123678", "BAD", "I12", "", "B125", "Z")  igr_is_valid(igrs) #> [1]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE

title: Irish Grid References in R
text: convert vector Irish grid references Irish Grid coordinates use igr_to_ig(). Irish grid references may spaces grid letter, easting northing: sample Irish grid references mix precisions. precisions metres can returned supplying column name precision data: list data.frame Irish grid references can converted sf object using st_igr_as_sf(). default geometries returned points located south west corner grid reference, coordinate reference system Irish Grid (EPSG:29903): points can plotted tmap package. basic outline Ireland United Kingdom can retrieved maps package.  Irish grid references can also converted polygon geometries. polygon spans full extent grid reference, set grid references varying precision result set polygons different sizes. Plotting polygons:
code: igrs <- c("A", "D12", "J53", "M5090", "N876274", "S1234550000", "W")  igr_to_ig(igrs) #> $x #> [1]      0 310000 350000 150000 287600 212345 100000 #>  #> $y #> [1] 400000 420000 330000 290000 227400 150000      0 igrs <- c("A", "D 12", "J 5 3", "M 50 90", "N 876 274", "S 12345 50000", "W")  igr_to_ig(igrs) #> $x #> [1]      0 310000 350000 150000 287600 212345 100000 #>  #> $y #> [1] 400000 420000 330000 290000 227400 150000      0 igr_to_ig(igrs, precision = "prec") #> $x #> [1]      0 310000 350000 150000 287600 212345 100000 #>  #> $y #> [1] 400000 420000 330000 290000 227400 150000      0 #>  #> $prec #> [1] 1e+05 1e+04 1e+04 1e+03 1e+02 1e+00 1e+05 igr_df <- data.frame(igr = igrs)  points_sf <- st_igr_as_sf(igr_df, "igr")  points_sf #> Simple feature collection with 7 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 0 xmax: 350000 ymax: 420000 #> Projected CRS: TM75 / Irish Grid #>             igr              geometry #> 1             A       POINT (0 4e+05) #> 2          D 12 POINT (310000 420000) #> 3         J 5 3 POINT (350000 330000) #> 4       M 50 90 POINT (150000 290000) #> 5     N 876 274 POINT (287600 227400) #> 6 S 12345 50000 POINT (212345 150000) #> 7             W       POINT (1e+05 0) library(maps) library(tmap)  ie_uk_sf <- maps::map("world",   regions = c("Ireland", "UK"),   plot = FALSE,   fill = TRUE ) |>   sf::st_as_sf(ie_uk) |>   sf::st_transform(29903)  tm_shape(points_sf, ext = 1.4) +   tm_dots(size = 1, col = "cornflowerblue") +   tm_text("igr", ymod = 1) +   tm_shape(ie_uk_sf) +   tm_borders() polygons_sf <- st_igr_as_sf(igr_df, "igr", polygons = TRUE)  polygons_sf #> Simple feature collection with 7 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 0 xmax: 360000 ymax: 5e+05 #> Projected CRS: TM75 / Irish Grid #>             igr                       geometry #> 1             A POLYGON ((1e+05 5e+05, 1e+0... #> 2          D 12 POLYGON ((320000 430000, 32... #> 3         J 5 3 POLYGON ((360000 340000, 36... #> 4       M 50 90 POLYGON ((151000 291000, 15... #> 5     N 876 274 POLYGON ((287700 227500, 28... #> 6 S 12345 50000 POLYGON ((212346 150001, 21... #> 7             W POLYGON ((2e+05 1e+05, 2e+0... tm_shape(ie_uk_sf, bbox = points_sf, ext = 1.4) +   tm_borders() +   tm_shape(polygons_sf, ext = 1.2) +   tm_polygons(size = 1, col = "cornflowerblue", alpha = 0.5) +   tm_text("igr", ymod = -1)

title: Irish Grid References in R
text: consistent behaviour sf::st_as_sf(), error returned Irish grid references supplied st_igr_as_sf() invalid. avoid scenario, invalid Irish grid references can filtered using igr_is_valid(): tidy r can written :
code: some_invalid_df <- data.frame(igr = c(igrs, "BAD", "I", "", "123", "N1"))  some_invalid_df #>              igr #> 1              A #> 2           D 12 #> 3          J 5 3 #> 4        M 50 90 #> 5      N 876 274 #> 6  S 12345 50000 #> 7              W #> 8            BAD #> 9              I #> 10               #> 11           123 #> 12            N1 valid_sf <- st_igr_as_sf(some_invalid_df[igr_is_valid(some_invalid_df$igr), , drop = FALSE])  valid_sf #> Simple feature collection with 7 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 0 xmax: 350000 ymax: 420000 #> Projected CRS: TM75 / Irish Grid #>             igr              geometry #> 1             A       POINT (0 4e+05) #> 2          D 12 POINT (310000 420000) #> 3         J 5 3 POINT (350000 330000) #> 4       M 50 90 POINT (150000 290000) #> 5     N 876 274 POINT (287600 227400) #> 6 S 12345 50000 POINT (212345 150000) #> 7             W       POINT (1e+05 0) valid_df <- some_invalid_df |>   dplyr::filter(igr_is_valid(igr)) |>   st_igr_as_sf()

title: Irish Grid References in R
text: Irish Grid coordinates can converted Irish grid references using ig_to_igr(). first two columns matrix supplied must Irish Grid X coordinate Y coordinate respectively. columns ignored. Spaces strings can inserted letter, easting northing: generated Irish grid references can limited particular precision specifying number digits easting northing. 0 (100 km precision) 5 (1 m precision) digits supported. Precision can also specified number metres. Multiples 10 1 m 100,000 m (100 km) supported. value supplied precision overrides values digits. data.frame Irish Grid coordinates can converted: sf object containing geometries type POINT can converted Irish grid references using st_irishgridrefs(): append Irish grid references (spaces) original sf object using base r: tidy r can written :
code: p <- matrix(c(0, 490000, 400000, 0, 453000, 4000), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE) colnames(p) <- c("x", "y")  p #>           x      y #> [1,]      0 490000 #> [2,] 400000      0 #> [3,] 453000   4000 ig_to_igr(p) #> [1] "A000900" "Z000000" "Z530040" ig_to_igr(p, sep = " ") #> [1] "A 000 900" "Z 000 000" "Z 530 040" ig_to_igr(p, digits = 1) # 10 km precision #> [1] "A09" "Z00" "Z50"  ig_to_igr(p, digits = 5) # 1 m precision #> [1] "A0000090000" "Z0000000000" "Z5300004000" ig_to_igr(p, precision = 10000) # 10 km precision #> [1] "A09" "Z00" "Z50"  ig_to_igr(p, precision = 1) # 1 m precision #> [1] "A0000090000" "Z0000000000" "Z5300004000" p_df <- data.frame(p)  p_df #>        x      y #> 1      0 490000 #> 2 400000      0 #> 3 453000   4000 ig_to_igr(p_df) #> [1] "A000900" "Z000000" "Z530040" p_sf <- sf::st_as_sf(p_df,   crs = 29903,   coords = c("x", "y") )  p_sf #> Simple feature collection with 3 features and 0 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 0 xmax: 453000 ymax: 490000 #> Projected CRS: TM75 / Irish Grid #>              geometry #> 1    POINT (0 490000) #> 2     POINT (4e+05 0) #> 3 POINT (453000 4000) st_irishgridrefs(p_sf) #> [1] "A000900" "Z000000" "Z530040" p_sf$igr <- st_irishgridrefs(p_sf, sep = " ")  p_sf #> Simple feature collection with 3 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 0 xmax: 453000 ymax: 490000 #> Projected CRS: TM75 / Irish Grid #>              geometry       igr #> 1    POINT (0 490000) A 000 900 #> 2     POINT (4e+05 0) Z 000 000 #> 3 POINT (453000 4000) Z 530 040 p_sf <- p_sf |>   dplyr::mutate(igr = st_irishgridrefs(sep = " "))

title: Authors and Citation
text: John Kennedy. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. . Funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kennedy J (2024). igr: Irish Grid Reference Utilities. R package version 0.0.0.9001, https://digitalnature-ie.github.io/igr/, https://github.com/digitalnature-ie/igr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {igr: Irish Grid Reference Utilities},   author = {John Kennedy},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9001,     https://digitalnature-ie.github.io/igr/},   url = {https://github.com/digitalnature-ie/igr}, }

title: Irish Grid Reference Utilities
text: Convert Irish grid references Irish Grid coordinates sf object. Irish grid reference consists letter, optionally followed easting northing. Irish grid reference refers square Irish Grid (EPSG:29903). letter alone (e.g. “N”) refers particular 100 km square. Irish grid reference 1-digit easting northing (e.g. “N85”) refers 10 km square. 5-digit easting northing (e.g. “N 12345 67890”) refers 1 m square. package supports Irish grid references 1 m, 10 m, 100 m, 1 km, 10 km 100 km precision. Irish grid references can mixed precision, whitespace letter, easting northing optional. converting Irish grid references point locations (using igr_to_ig(), st_igr_as_sf() default polygons=FALSE), south west corners relevant Irish Grid squares returned. converting polygons (using st_igr_as_sf() polygons=TRUE), polygons returned span entire square grid reference. functions st_igr_as_sf() st_irishgridrefs() convert sf (simple feature) objects coordinate reference system.

title: Irish Grid Reference Utilities
text: install development version igr:
code: # Install devtools package if needed install.packages("devtools")  # Load devtools package if needed library(devtools)       # Install development version of igr package from github install_github("digitalnature-ie/igr")

title: Irish Grid Reference Utilities
text: check validity Irish grid references: igr_is_valid() indicates elements character vector valid Irish grid references convert Irish grid references: igr_to_ig() converts vector Irish grid references matrix Irish Grid coordinates st_igr_as_sf() converts data.frame containing Irish grid references sf object containing points polygons convert Irish grid references: ig_to_igr() converts list matrix Irish Grid coordinates Irish grid references st_irishgridrefs() converts sf object Irish grid references

title: Irish Grid Reference Utilities
code: library(igr)  # Sample grid references igrs <- c("A", "A16", "A123678", "BAD", "I12", "", "B125", "Z")  igr_is_valid(igrs) #> [1]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE

title: Irish Grid Reference Utilities
code: # Sample grid references igrs <- c("A", "D12", "J53", "M5090", "N876274", "S1234550000", "W")  # Converting to Irish Grid coordinates igr_to_ig(igrs) #> $x #> [1]      0 310000 350000 150000 287600 212345 100000 #>  #> $y #> [1] 400000 420000 330000 290000 227400 150000      0 # Sample grid references in a data.frame igrs_df <- data.frame(igr = igrs)  # Converting to an sf object of POINT features st_igr_as_sf(igrs_df, "igr") #> Simple feature collection with 7 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 0 xmax: 350000 ymax: 420000 #> Projected CRS: TM75 / Irish Grid #>           igr              geometry #> 1           A       POINT (0 4e+05) #> 2         D12 POINT (310000 420000) #> 3         J53 POINT (350000 330000) #> 4       M5090 POINT (150000 290000) #> 5     N876274 POINT (287600 227400) #> 6 S1234550000 POINT (212345 150000) #> 7           W       POINT (1e+05 0) # Converting to an sf object of POLYGON features st_igr_as_sf(igrs_df, "igr", polygon = TRUE) #> Simple feature collection with 7 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 0 xmax: 360000 ymax: 5e+05 #> Projected CRS: TM75 / Irish Grid #>           igr                       geometry #> 1           A POLYGON ((1e+05 5e+05, 1e+0... #> 2         D12 POLYGON ((320000 430000, 32... #> 3         J53 POLYGON ((360000 340000, 36... #> 4       M5090 POLYGON ((151000 291000, 15... #> 5     N876274 POLYGON ((287700 227500, 28... #> 6 S1234550000 POLYGON ((212346 150001, 21... #> 7           W POLYGON ((2e+05 1e+05, 2e+0...

title: Irish Grid Reference Utilities
code: # Sample Irish Grid coordinates p <- matrix(c(0, 490000, 400000, 0, 453000, 4000), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE) colnames(p) <- c("x", "y")  p #>           x      y #> [1,]      0 490000 #> [2,] 400000      0 #> [3,] 453000   4000 # Convert to Irish grid references ig_to_igr(p) #> [1] "A000900" "Z000000" "Z530040" # Sample Irish Grid coordinates in an sf object p_sf <- sf::st_as_sf(data.frame(p), crs = 29903, coords = c("x", "y"))  # Convert sf object to Irish grid references st_irishgridrefs(p_sf, sep = " ") #> [1] "A 000 900" "Z 000 000" "Z 530 040" # Append Irish grid references to original sf object (using base R) p_sf$igr <- st_irishgridrefs(p_sf)  # Append Irish grid references to original sf object (using tidy R) p_sf <- p_sf |>   dplyr::mutate(igr = st_irishgridrefs(p_sf))

title: Irish Grid Reference Utilities
text: package designed work seamlessly tidy R. Function names, parameter names, function behaviour attempt follow conventions related R packages sf. helpful 2nd edition R Packages Hadley Wickham Jennifer Bryan consulted extensively development. code implemented using base R possible minimise package dependencies, adopts tidyverse coding style.

title: Irish Grid Reference Utilities
text: Please log unexpected behaviour suggestions via GitHub Issues.

what: Convert Irish Grid coordinates to Irish grid references — ig_to_igr
title: Convert Irish Grid coordinates to Irish grid references — ig_to_igr
text: ig_to_igr() returns Irish grid references specified precision valid Irish Grid (EPSG:29903) coordinates, otherwise NA.

title: Convert Irish Grid coordinates to Irish grid references — ig_to_igr
code: ig_to_igr(x, digits = 3, precision = NULL, sep = "")

title: Convert Irish Grid coordinates to Irish grid references — ig_to_igr
text: x matrix containing Irish Grid eastings northings first second columns respectively. digits integer, number digits easting northing Irish grid references. 0: equivalent precision 100 km. 1: equivalent precision 10 km. 2: equivalent precision 1 km. 3 (default): equivalent precision 100 m. 4: equivalent precision 10 m. 5: equivalent precision 1 m. precision integer, precision Irish grid references metres: 1, 10, 100, 1000, 10000, 100000. Overrides digits. sep character string separate 100 km grid letter, easting, northing.

title: Convert Irish Grid coordinates to Irish grid references — ig_to_igr
text: character vector Irish grid references.

title: Convert Irish Grid coordinates to Irish grid references — ig_to_igr
text: Either digits precision must specified. precision overrides digits.

title: Convert Irish Grid coordinates to Irish grid references — ig_to_igr
code: # A matrix of three Irish Grid coordinates m <- matrix(c(0, 412300, 0, 98700, 456000, 0), byrow = TRUE, ncol = 2)  m #>        [,1]   [,2] #> [1,]      0 412300 #> [2,]      0  98700 #> [3,] 456000      0  # Convert to Irish grid references ig_to_igr(m) #> [1] "A000123" "V000987" "Z560000"  # Insert a space between the 100 km grid letter, easting, and northing ig_to_igr(m, sep = " ") #> [1] "A 000 123" "V 000 987" "Z 560 000"  # Convert into Irish grid references with 4 digit easting and northing (10 m precision) ig_to_igr(m, digits = 4) #> [1] "A00001230" "V00009870" "Z56000000"  # Convert into Irish grid references with 1 km precision (2 digit easting and northing) ig_to_igr(m, precision = 1000) #> [1] "A0012" "V0098" "Z5600"

what: igr: Irish Grid Reference Utilities — igr-package
title: igr: Irish Grid Reference Utilities — igr-package
text: Convert Irish grid references Irish Grid coordinates sf object.

title: igr: Irish Grid Reference Utilities — igr-package
text: Maintainer: John Kennedy john@digitalnature.ie (ORCID) [copyright holder] contributors: Digital Nature [funder]

what: Check if Irish grid references are valid — igr_is_valid
title: Check if Irish grid references are valid — igr_is_valid
text: igr_is_valid() identifies valid Irish grid references.

title: Check if Irish grid references are valid — igr_is_valid
code: igr_is_valid(x)

title: Check if Irish grid references are valid — igr_is_valid
text: x character vector Irish grid references.

title: Check if Irish grid references are valid — igr_is_valid
text: logical vector indicating whether Irish grid reference whether valid.

title: Check if Irish grid references are valid — igr_is_valid
text: Valid Irish grid references consist letter () optionally followed easting northing. easting northing must length 1 5 digits. may whitespace letter, easting northing.

title: Check if Irish grid references are valid — igr_is_valid
code: # A vector of alternating valid and invalid Irish grid references v <- c("N8090", "D 12 345 88800", "W34", "I30", "W", "A123", "B1234", "")  # Check validity of Irish Grid coordinates igr_is_valid(v) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE

what: Convert Irish grid references to Irish Grid coordinates — igr_to_ig
title: Convert Irish grid references to Irish Grid coordinates — igr_to_ig
text: igr_to_ig() converts Irish grid references list Irish Grid (EPSG:29903) x y coordinates. precision Irish grid reference metres can returned.

title: Convert Irish grid references to Irish Grid coordinates — igr_to_ig
code: igr_to_ig(x, coords = c("x", "y"), precision = NULL)

title: Convert Irish grid references to Irish Grid coordinates — igr_to_ig
text: x character vector Irish grid references. See igr_is_valid() definition valid Irish grid references. coords character vector names columns contain Irish Grid X Y coordinates respectively. precision name column contain precision grid reference metres, required.

title: Convert Irish grid references to Irish Grid coordinates — igr_to_ig
text: list containing Irish Grid x y coordinates (optionally) precision metres Irish grid reference. Invalid Irish grid references return NA.

title: Convert Irish grid references to Irish Grid coordinates — igr_to_ig
code: # A vector of three Irish grid references of different precisions v <- c("N8090", "D1234588800", "W34")  # Convert to Irish Grid coordinates igr_to_ig(v) #> $x #> [1] 280000 312345 130000 #>  #> $y #> [1] 290000 488800  40000 #>   # Specify column names igr_to_ig(v, coords = c("e", "n")) #> $e #> [1] 280000 312345 130000 #>  #> $n #> [1] 290000 488800  40000 #>   # Also return the precision in metres of each grid reference igr_to_ig(v, precision = "prec") #> $x #> [1] 280000 312345 130000 #>  #> $y #> [1] 290000 488800  40000 #>  #> $prec #> [1]  1000     1 10000 #>

what: Convert data frame containing Irish grid references to an sf object — st_igr_as_sf
title: Convert data frame containing Irish grid references to an sf object — st_igr_as_sf
text: st_igr_as_sf() transforms Irish grid references sf object containing point polygon features. points, south west corners grid references returned. polygons, squares spanning full extent grid reference returned, square's size depending precision grid reference. Irish Grid (EPSG:29903) x y coordinates grid reference precision metres can also returned.

title: Convert data frame containing Irish grid references to an sf object — st_igr_as_sf
code: st_igr_as_sf(   x,   igrefs = "igr",   crs = 29903,   remove = FALSE,   add_coords = FALSE,   coords = c("x", "y"),   precision = NULL,   polygons = FALSE )

title: Convert data frame containing Irish grid references to an sf object — st_igr_as_sf
text: x object containing column Irish grid references. must column names specified coords, invalid Irish grid references. igrefs name index character column holding Irish grid references. crs valid EPSG value (numeric), string accepted GDAL, object class crs containing coordinate reference system assigned. See sf::st_crs(). remove column containing Irish grid references removed result? add_coords Irish Grid coordinate columns names specified coords included result? coords character vector names columns contain Irish Grid X Y coordinates respectively. precision name column contain precision grid reference metres, required. polygons FALSE (default) result contain point features located south-west corner grid reference. TRUE result contain polygon features spanning extent grid reference.

title: Convert data frame containing Irish grid references to an sf object — st_igr_as_sf
text: sf object containing point polygon features Irish grid reference x.

title: Convert data frame containing Irish grid references to an sf object — st_igr_as_sf
code: # A data.frame containing two Irish grid references x <- data.frame(igr = c("A00", "N8000"))  # Convert a data.frame of Irish grid references to an sf object in the # Irish Grid coordinate reference system st_igr_as_sf(x, "igr") #> Simple feature collection with 2 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 2e+05 xmax: 280000 ymax: 4e+05 #> Projected CRS: TM75 / Irish Grid #>     igr             geometry #> 1   A00      POINT (0 4e+05) #> 2 N8000 POINT (280000 2e+05)  # Convert to an sf object in the WGS 84 coordinate reference system st_igr_as_sf(x, "igr", crs = 4326) #> Simple feature collection with 2 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -11.1116 ymin: 53.04498 xmax: -6.807924 ymax: 54.80789 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>     igr                   geometry #> 1   A00  POINT (-11.1116 54.80789) #> 2 N8000 POINT (-6.807924 53.04498)  # Include the Irish Grid coordinates and precision in the sf object st_igr_as_sf(x, "igr", add_coords = TRUE, precision = "prec") #> Simple feature collection with 2 features and 4 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 2e+05 xmax: 280000 ymax: 4e+05 #> Projected CRS: TM75 / Irish Grid #>     igr      x     y  prec             geometry #> 1   A00      0 4e+05 10000      POINT (0 4e+05) #> 2 N8000 280000 2e+05  1000 POINT (280000 2e+05)  # Convert into polygons rather than points st_igr_as_sf(x, "igr", polygons = TRUE) #> Simple feature collection with 2 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 2e+05 xmax: 281000 ymax: 410000 #> Projected CRS: TM75 / Irish Grid #>     igr                       geometry #> 1   A00 POLYGON ((10000 410000, 100... #> 2 N8000 POLYGON ((281000 201000, 28...

what: Generate Irish grid references from an sf object — st_irishgridrefs
title: Generate Irish grid references from an sf object — st_irishgridrefs
text: st_irishgridrefs() returns Irish grid references point geometries sf object located within Irish Grid (EPSG:29903), NA otherwise.

title: Generate Irish grid references from an sf object — st_irishgridrefs
code: st_irishgridrefs(x, digits = 3, precision = NULL, sep = "")

title: Generate Irish grid references from an sf object — st_irishgridrefs
text: x sf object containing geometries type POINT. digits integer, number digits easting northing Irish grid references. 0: equivalent precision 100 km. 1: equivalent precision 10 km. 2: equivalent precision 1 km. 3 (default): equivalent precision 100 m. 4: equivalent precision 10 m. 5: equivalent precision 1 m. precision integer, precision Irish grid references metres: 1, 10, 100, 1000, 10000, 100000. Overrides digits. sep character string separate 100 km grid letter, easting, northing.

title: Generate Irish grid references from an sf object — st_irishgridrefs
text: character vector Irish grid references.

title: Generate Irish grid references from an sf object — st_irishgridrefs
code: # An sf object containing point data x_sf <- sf::st_as_sf(data.frame(x = c(0, 490000), y = c(400000, 0)),   crs = 29903,   coords = c("x", "y") )  # Convert to Irish grid references st_irishgridrefs(x_sf) #> [1] "A000000" "Z900000"  # Convert into Irish grid references with 4 digit easting and northing (10 m precision) st_irishgridrefs(x_sf, digits = 4) #> [1] "A00000000" "Z90000000"  # Convert into Irish grid references with 1 km precision (2 digit easting and northing) st_irishgridrefs(x_sf, precision = 1000) #> [1] "A0000" "Z9000"  # Insert a space between the 100 km grid letter, easting, and northing st_irishgridrefs(x_sf, sep = " ") #> [1] "A 000 000" "Z 900 000"
